page.title: 04Arts and Crafts
page.content: Not much is known about individual art and craft work in the area. Apart from instruction in schools, the only organised programme of craft demonstrations is carried out by the Womens' Rural Institute, and the subjects covered include spinning, weaving, crochet, cookery, macrame, embroidery, enamelling and flower arranging. One demonstration, e.g., showed the complete process from spinning wool to producing a finished article of clothing. Recently a silver smith has come to live in the area, who gives demonstrations of her craft to groups, and the production of ornamental iron work on a forge is still carried out at Kellas Smithy.
